name: Home
instructions:
You could:

\
    \
  • introduce the main characters, and
    • \
  • introduce the time, and
    • \
  • introduce the place, and
    • \
  • introduce the situation.
    • \

name: Split Up
instructions:
For example:

\
    \
  • grown-ups leave children alone, or
    • \
  • children go away on their own.
    • \

name: Warning
instructions:
The HERO or the VICTIM is told that:

\
    \
  • they must do something, or
    • \
  • they must not do something.
    • \

name: Ignored
instructions:
\
  • They do not do what they were told to do, or
    • \
  • they do what they were told not to do.
    • \

name: Spying
description: The VILLAIN tries to get some information.
instructions:
The villain could try to find out something about: the thing he wants to steal or damage, or the victim he wants to kidnap or harm.

\

He might try to find out by: spying, or asking questions, or your own idea.

\

Or the HERO tries to find out something about the VILLAIN.

name: Information
description: Someone gets the information they want.
instructions:
The villain finds out something about: the thing he wants to steal or damage, or the victim he wants to kidnap or harm.

\

Or the HERO finds out something about the VILLAIN.

name: Trickery
description: The VILLAIN tries to get the VICTIM to do something.
instructions: The villain could try to: trick the victim, or persuade the victim, or use magic on the victim, to get the victim to do what he wants.

name: Tricked
instructions: The victim: falls for the villain's trick, or agrees to the villain's persuasions, or falls under the villain's magic spell, and does what the villain wants.

name: Villainy!
instructions:
The villain could:

\
    \
  • steal or damage something,
    • \
  • kidnap or harm the victim,
    • \
  • or your own idea.
    • \

name: Finds Out
description: The HERO finds out about the villainy.
instructions:
The hero could find out about the villainy because:

\
    \
  • someone calls for help, or
    • \
  • someone tells the hero about it, or
    • \
  • someone asks the hero to help, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \

name: Decides
description: The HERO decides to go on a journey to put right the villainy.

name: Leaves
description: The HERO leaves on a journey to put right the villainy.

name: Test
instructions:
The donor could:

\
    \
  • ask the hero a question, or
    • \
  • ask the hero for help, or
    • \
  • attack the hero, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \

name: Answer
instructions:
The hero could:

\
    \
  • answer the donor's question correctly or incorrectly, or
    • \
  • help or not help the donor, or
    • \
  • win or lose the fight with the donor, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \

name: Magic
instructions:
The magic thing could be: a magic animal that helps the hero, or a magic object, or a magic power.

\

The hero could get it because: the donor gives it to the hero, or the hero steals it from the donor, or your own idea.

name: Arrives
description: The HERO gets to the destination of the journey.
instructions: They might get there by: travelling on an animal, or travelling on something magic, or following someone, or finding a special entrance, or your own idea.

name: Struggle
description: The HERO confronts the VILLAIN using cleverness or combat.
instructions:
For example:

\
    \
  • The hero fights the villain, or
    • \
  • the hero plays a game against the villain, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \

name: Defeat
instructions:
For example:

\
    \
  • the villain loses the fight against the hero, or
    • \
  • the villain loses the game against the hero, or
    • \
  • the villain gets scared off, or
    • \
  • the villain gets killed.
    • \

name: Put right
instructions:
For example:

\
    \
  • the thing that the villain stole is returned, or
    • \
  • the person that the villain kidnapped is returned, or
    • \
  • the thing that the villain broke is fixed, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \

name: Return
description: The HERO sets out to return home or escapes from the VILLAIN.

name: Rescue
description: The HERO escapes or is rescued from the VILLAIN's chase.

name: Punishment
instructions:
Choose from:

\
    \
  • The villain is punished, or
    • \
  • the villain is forgiven.
    • \

name: Reward
instructions:
For example:

\
    \
  • the hero gets married, or
    • \
  • the hero gets a new home, or
    • \
  • the hero gets money or nice things, or
    • \
  • your own idea.
    • \
